revised_title: On the Thermal Resistance of Liquids: Experimental Results and Analysis
tldr: This article presents experiments conducted by Frederick Guthrie to determine the thermal resistance of various liquids. Guthrie uses a diathermometer to measure the resistance of liquids, including water, and finds that hotter water conducts heat better than colder water. The study also shows that the addition of salts to water increases its thermal resistance, and provides a list of specific liquid resistances compared to water.
